main event: On June 10, 1949, a military pilot observed a white, 100-ft long flying tube approximately 30,000 feet above ground, traveling at 100 mph in the southwest of Boston, Massachusetts. The pilot chased the object but lost it in overcast conditions.
interesting points: The sighting occurred at 0845 local time during overcast weather with scattered clouds at 1,200 feet.
The object was reported to be perpendicular to the earth and was observed by the pilot of an AT-6 aircraft from a distance of 6 miles.
No sound, trail, or exhaust was associated with the object, and the speed was estimated to be between 100-150 mph.
The document does not mention any physical evidence such as photographs or debris related to the sighting.
The observer, a pilot from the 58th Fighter Squadron at Otis Air Force Base in Falmouth, Massachusetts, reported the sighting to the relevant authorities.
witnesses: Military pilot from the 58th Fighter Squadron
